section.title: Introduction
section.para: The coordinator should establish an agency SitRep immediately on entering the SEOC. The same SitRep will be maintained by the coordinator and the station. Encourage the station to make frequent updates when contacts are made relevant to the incident. The coordinator's updates will typically be summaries of station activities as well as information on other leadership the coordinator has contacted by telephone.

It is important to many agencies to be alert to the state of readiness of the RACES station. Agencies have discovered that their communications circuits are sometimes fragile, and they may require our services. An up to date and accurate SitRep gives them some confidence about our status.
In any case, be sure the Agency SitRep is complete, accurate, and up to date. The SitRep should be updated at least once per hour.

listitem.para:
Log on to E-Team using the password provided by the DIT rep (typically Rich Law or Jaclyn Barcroft). They will usually log you on.
Use SEOC-specific password
Do not use your personal password when logging on at
the SEOC.
Update the agency sitrep approximately hourly. Often, the SEOC rep and the station will share a SitRep.
Add Duty Log entries if needed (typically not required)
Review the incident report and other agency SitReps
Be certain to review all numbered messages from message control, either paper copies distributed to the auxcomm desk or on E-Team.
